Uses of Class
com.complexible.common.pool.PoolConfig

  • Packages that use PoolConfig 
    Package Description
    com.complexible.common.pool  
    com.complexible.stardog.api
    Provides the core SNARL (Stardog Native API for the RDF Language) classes and interfaces for programmatic access to the Stardog DBMS.

    • Uses of PoolConfig in com.complexible.common.pool

      Subclasses of PoolConfig in com.complexible.common.pool 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ApachePoolConfig<T>
      Abstract base class for instantiating a pool backed by Apache Pool.
      Methods in com.complexible.common.pool that return PoolConfig 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PoolConfig<T,E> PoolConfig.blockAtCapacity(long theTime, TimeUnit theUnit)
      Set the amount of time to wait to obtain an object.
      PoolConfig<T,E> PoolConfig.expiration(long theTime, TimeUnit theUnit)
      Specifes the minimum amount of time something should remain idle for before it is eligible to be expired.
      PoolConfig<T,E> PoolConfig.failAtCapacity()
      Configure the pool to fail to obtain an object if you are at maxPool(int) objects.
      PoolConfig<T,E> PoolConfig.growAtCapacity()
      Configure the pool to grow if it is at maxPool(int) objects, effectively rendering the max moot.
      PoolConfig<T,E> PoolConfig.maxIdle(int theMaxIdle)
      The maximum number of objects which are allowed to sit idle in the pool.
      PoolConfig<T,E> PoolConfig.maxPool(int theMax)
      Set the maximum number of objects that can be active in the pool (leased or idle).
      PoolConfig<T,E> PoolConfig.minPool(int theMin)
      Set the minimum size of the pool, ie, the number of objects to start with.
      PoolConfig<T,E> PoolConfig.noExpiration()
      Set that entries should not timeout/expire while idle

    • Uses of PoolConfig in com.complexible.stardog.api

      Subclasses of PoolConfig in com.complexible.stardog.api 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ConnectionPoolConfig
      A configuration object for creating connection pools.
